name: Woodlands Country House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 6 of us spent a fabulous couple of days at this wonderful b&b. The hosts and staff are friendly and helpful. There is real milk available for you to make your own tea or coffee in the room (one of my bugbears) and even a jar of homemade biscuits. The bedroom and bathroom were spotlessly clean. Pippa even provided an ice bucket and champagne flutes for our own bottle of bubbles. As others have stated, the breakfast is legendary. The location is convenient to Padstow and many other local attractions. We hope to return and would highly recommend Woodland Country House.
reviews.title: What a find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have never enjoyed a stay in a bed and breakfast so much. We knew we had booked the right place within seconds of arriving. Very friendly staff, beautiful rooms and grounds. Many little extras from dvds and books available to borrow - to teddy bears in case you have forgotten to pack your own. I'm very hard to impress with breakfast, but really was here. We would recommend this country house to everyone, and thank Pippa and Hugo for making our stay so lovely whilst on our honeymoon. I don't think I have ever felt so relaxed. We wish we could have stayed the week.
reviews.title: The ultimate stay if you want to relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: a superbly decorated house with comfortable homely touches. pippa and hugo made us feel so welcome and the other team members were very relaxed and friendly. housekeeping and breakfast were five star hotel standard.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we are already talking about a return visit because we felt so relaxed,
reviews.title: Hugo's breakfasts - more legendary than King Arthur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011
reviews.text: We returned again to Hugo and Pippa's fantastic beautiful country house. As usual the rooms were spotless and well furnished. The service was superb but not fussy, little touches like home made buscuits and real milk for tea separate this establishment from the Pack. If they separate Woodlands from the competition Hugo's lengendary breakfast applies the Coup de grace. His feast of an English breakfast and a wide range of options is simply unsurpassed. Top quality, beautifully cooked hearty portions and wonderful service accompanied by local organic juices, home made cakes and freshly brewed coffee, a real treat worth a michelin star on it's own.
reviews.title: Stunning, friendly and very relaxing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed last weekend and had 3 rooms. My aunt is a wheelchair user and their adapted room (number 10) was very well prepared for her with a roll in shower and room to move. Ramps around the property make it easy to get into the dining area too.
reviews.title: Fantastic Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is exceptional. My Dad had the special one morning which was smoked salmon and scrambled egg - I had locally smoked haddock one morning - there is a wonderful selection with many home made delights - Hogo's Banana bread is fab - so are their home made sausages.
reviews.title: Friendly welcome and excellent room..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hugo and Pippa and their lovely staff are great - highly recommended.
reviews.title: OMG! What a fabulous place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were made welcome upon our arrival. The room was excellent. The staff helpful and friendly.. The breakfast was first class.
reviews.title: Excellent B&B - we found it absolutely perfect, will go back!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful value for money.. we shall return.
reviews.title: Friendly B&B with lovely views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husand and I spent a night here back in September, I have to say it was one of the loveliest places I've ever stayed. We were given a very warm welcome by Pippa, and shown around, and the room we had was absolutely amazing (the Bay room) with a huge, luxurious four poster bed and a beautiful view over the grounds. Absolutely everythng we could have wanted was provided for us. The attention to detail is fabulous.
reviews.title: Pure luxury!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's short walk into Padstow itself, but along a busy road, so we did take a taxi back in the evenning, upon returning, we enjoyed a drink from the luciously stocked bar in the comfortable drawing room, slept like logs in the marvellous bed, and the breakfast the next day was absolutely wonderful, definitely award winning!! (Hugo's marmalade flapjacks were absolutely brilliant!)
reviews.title: Lovely up market B&B near Padstow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had a fabulous time there, would love to go back next time we're in the area, it's a wonderful place and an absolute haven. Thank you Pippa and Hugo!
reviews.title: Fabulous stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: The room we stayed in here was absolutely lovely, with beautiful furnishings and great attention to detail. The owners were very helpful and friendly and the breakfast absolutely first class. This is a lovely place to stay as a couple or with friends, but probably not for young children as the place is beautifully tidy and peaceful
reviews.title: Another fantastic stay with Hugo and Pippa!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was responsible for sourcing accomodation on our annual girlie weekend. How lucky I was to stumble upon Hugo and Pippa's place! The friendliness of Pippa on the phone when I enquired about what we could expect clinched the deal.
reviews.title: Amazing Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a three night stay at Woodlands and only regret it wasn't longer.
reviews.title: One of The Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is clear from the moment you arrive the love and care that has gone into making it a wonderful place to stay.
reviews.title: Lovely and relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Marvellous hospitality from Pippa and Hugo, friendly efficent staff, spotlessly clean room with all the nice added touches that give added quality.The highlight of the stay is undoubtedly the breakfasts, which are" fit for a king". Great locallly sourced ingredients, well cooked and presented, in one of the nicest breakfast rooms with views over the Cornish countryside.
reviews.title: A seaside gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Looking forward to our next visit.
reviews.title: A lovely b and b, fantastic breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in May (just took me a while to do this review!!) for a special birthday for my husband. Reallty warm wecome from Pippa who showed us around and up to our room, the Jade Room which was lovely everything was spotlessly clean, there was plenty of tea/coffee and fresh milk available in the fridge outside the room and the homemade biscuits were a real treat. I had arranged for a bottle of Champagne as a surprise. There is a lovely view from the room with the sea in the distance. Breakfast is a delight Hugo is a very good cook, had the scrambled eggs with smoked salmon delicious! You can even book tickets to the Eden Project through them and they will also provide you with directions which were very good we didnt get lost. We had a lovely time and will definitely return.
reviews.title: Didn;t want to com home.

description: Woodlands Country House is a comfortable bed and breakfast guesthouse, a large Victorian house standing in a rural setting with farmland views, sweeping down to Trevone Bay and the coastline. There are eight en-suite double and/or twin rooms all individually and stylishly decorated - four Standard rooms, four Premier rooms. There is an honesty bar in the guest sitting room and outside; a car park and gardens. In the morning enjoy our famous Cornish breakfast. Accommodation with breakfast with a touch of splendor.
